William Kilmer正在与C5 Capital的合作伙伴，这是一个投资安全数据生态系统的风险投资基金。他以前是Mercato增长合作伙伴的经营合作伙伴，并担任CEO和摩托罗拉收购的董事长，Avinti（与M86安全合并），并担任M86安全首席营销官/首席战略官（由TrustWave收购） 。
  麦肯锡发现，2012年至2018年，共投资交易的价值增加到1040亿美元。通过一些计数，有多达1,600名“非传统”投资者有助于在2021年资助风险投资。
 非传统投资者的主要动机正在寻求更好的回报，并与VC基金一起投资是实现这一目标的好方法。最近的预票研究表明，共同投资基金明显优于传统资金。
 研究表明，80％的投资者发现他们的共同投资优于私募股权基金投资，占率超过5％的价格超过了46％。与传统的私募股权或VC资金相比，投资者还受益于一般昂贵的费用结构。
  共同投资者也可以通过分享投资风险来利润，这使所有投资者都受益，并建立忠诚和信任。由于这种投资需要一项动手的方法，投资者有机会与顶级赞助商密切合作 - 普遍合作伙伴（GPS） - 促进更深入的关系，并更好地了解GPS的投资策略和交易审查流程。对于新投资者来说，建立这些关系对于长期加强自己的投资技能至关重要。
  替代投资者不是唯一受益于协同投资的人，这也是GPS的福音。他们通过与替代投资者合作获得更广泛的融资选择，他们可以更有效地利用自己的资金，并使用前瞻性投资。
 VCS也有其他好处：虽然共同投资LPS在业务中保持被动，但VC可以使用投票权来保护投资者权利并巩固决策。它还允许他们在留在多样化限制范围内，在任何公司中都要在任何公司中工作。
note_en:
William Kilmer is managing partner with  C5 Capital, a venture capital fund investing in the secure data ecosystem. He was formerly an operating partner at Mercato Growth Partners and served as CEO and chairman of PublicEngines (acquired by Motorola), and Avinti (merged with M86 Security) and served as chief marketing officer/chief strategy officer of M86 Security (acquired by Trustwave).
  McKinsey  found that the value of co-investment deals has more than doubled to $104 billion from 2012 to 2018. And by some counts, there are as many as  1,600 “nontraditional” investors helping to fund venture capital deals in 2021.
 The primary motivator for nontraditional investors is seeking better returns, and investing alongside VC funds is a great way to achieve that. A recent  Preqin study shows co-investing funds significantly outperform traditional funds.
 Research shows that 80% of investors found their co-investments outperforming private equity fund investments, with 46% outperforming by a margin of more than 5%. Investors also benefit from a generally less expensive fee structure compared to traditional private equity or VC funds.
  Co-investors can also profit by sharing the investment risk, which benefits all investors and builds loyalty and trust. And because this kind of investing requires a hands-on approach, investors get the chance to work closely with top sponsors — the general partners (GPs) — to foster deeper relationships and gain a better understanding of the GPs’ investment strategies and deal review processes. For new investors, building these relationships is essential for strengthening their own investment skills in the long run.
  Alternative investors aren’t the only ones who benefit from co-investing, it’s also a boon for GPs. They gain a broader array of funding options by partnering with alternative investors, and they can leverage their own capital more effectively with prospective investments.
 VCs have other benefits too: While co-investing LPs remain passive in the business, the VC can use that voting power to preserve investor rights and consolidate decision-making. It also allows them to put more money to work in any company while staying within diversification limits.
title: VCS如何充分利用LPS与LPS共同投资
title_en: How VCs can get the most out of co-investing alongside LPs

 竞争对手喜欢时尚采取“脱离”的内容审核方法，允许任何人启动时事通讯。但是，目前在Facebook公告中的每个作家都被挑选为贡献。尽管如此，食肉仍然通过其争议的家喻户口计划来补贴防跨修辞，该专业程序委托特定作家在家中写作。因此，尽管其严重策划模型，但仍不会对困扰困扰的问题不会免疫。
  公告上的作家初始板岩包括Malcom Grortwell，Mitch Abom，Eri​​n Andrews和Tan France  - 常见问题解答还指出，其Beta计划是美国以美国为中心的，目前只有两名国际作家（“我们希望更多地包含更多国际作家国际创造者在我们的Beta计划发布后，“Bulletin说。）Facebook正在向其作家支付他们的贡献，到目前为止，并不计划削减他们的利润。如果作家选择关闭平台，他们将有能力与他们一起获取用户列表。
note_en:
Bulletin is built on a separate platform from Facebook — on its  website, the FAQ states that this is to “enable creators to grow their audience in ways that are not exclusively dependent on the Facebook platform.” You don’t need a Facebook account to subscribe to a newsletter, but Bulletin relies on Facebook’s infrastructure, including the use of Facebook Pay to purchase premium subscriptions and join subscriber-only groups and live audio rooms.
 Competitors like Substack take a “ hands-off” approach to content moderation, allowing anyone to start a newsletter. But every writer currently on Facebook’s Bulletin was hand-picked to contribute. Still, Substack has received scrutiny for  subsidizing anti-trans rhetoric through its controversial  Substack Pro program, which commissioned particular writers to write on Substack. So, Bulletin won’t be immune to the issues that plague Substack despite its heavily curated model.
  The initial slate of writers on Bulletin includes Malcom Gladwell, Mitch Albom, Erin Andrews, and Tan France — the FAQ also notes that its beta program is US-centric, with only two international writers at the moment (“We will look to include more international creators after our beta program launch,” Bulletin says.) Facebook is  paying its writers up front for their contributions, and so far, doesn’t plan to take a cut of their profits. If writers choose to move off the platform, they will have the ability to take their subscriber lists with them.
title: Facebook的时事通讯平台公告现已直播
title_en: Facebook’s newsletter platform Bulletin is now live

 加利福尼亚州圣克拉拉公司披露了英特尔Xeon和记忆集团负责人的Lisa Spelman的星期二博客文章的延迟，他们嘲笑CPU的新微型架构以及Xeon阵容将新的两个功能：下一代深度学习升压和称为英特尔数据流加速器的加速引擎。
  Spelman表示，英特尔正在延迟蓝宝石急流，最近推出的冰湖服务器处理器的10纳米后继者，因为验证CPU需要额外的时间。
 “鉴于蓝宝石Rapids中的增强尺寸，我们在生产发布之前纳入了额外的验证时间，这将简化客户和合作伙伴的部署过程。基于这一点，我们现在预计蓝宝石急流在2022年的第一季度将在2022年的第一季度，在2022年的第二季度开始，“Spelman写道。
 在去年的多个陈述中，英特尔表示，它旨在在2021年开始发运蓝宝石急流，但近几个月开始搬家，新的首席执行官Pat Gelsinger在3月份表示，英特尔旨在为CPU进入生产“周围”年底。”在英特尔的Computex 2021在本月初的主题演讲中，Spelman表示，Sapphire Rapids已设置为2022年推出。
 尚不清楚生产延迟的挫折是多少，但英特尔的处理器使用10纳米和7纳米这样的下一代制造工艺的处理器面临多年来的多个延误，这为竞争对手AMD和公司开发了额外的优势。基于CPU。这有助于AMD将X86 CPU股份增长到服务器市场的8.9％。 AMD在一年内，也已经在世界上第500强超级计算机的份额进行了四倍。
 延误是2月首席执行官盖尔格林格的一个主要原因，因为他努力将公司带回“无耻辱的领导”，就已经为本公司执行了最重要的优先事项。 
“客户必须能够依靠英特尔为其产品及其未来的策略，”他在2月份的一封信中表示。 “虽然我们必须设定积极的目标来重新获得股权和领导力，但它们也必须可以实现并以最高质量完成。”
note_en:
Intel has delayed production of its next-generation Xeon Scalable CPUs, code-named Sapphire Rapids, to the first quarter of 2022 and said it will start ramping shipments by at least April of next year.
 The Santa Clara, Calif.-based company disclosed the delay in a Tuesday blog post by Lisa Spelman, head of Intel’s Xeon and Memory Group, who teased the CPU’s new microarchitecture as well as two features that will be new to the Xeon lineup: the next generation of Deep Learning Boost and an acceleration engine called Intel Data Streaming Accelerator.
  Spelman said Intel is delaying Sapphire Rapids, the 10-nanometer successor to the recently launched  Ice Lake server processors, because of extra time needed to validate the CPU.
 “Given the breadth of enhancements in Sapphire Rapids, we are incorporating additional validation time prior to the production release, which will streamline the deployment process for our customers and partners. Based on this, we now expect Sapphire Rapids to be in production in the first quarter of 2022, with ramp beginning in the second quarter of 2022,” Spelman wrote.
 In multiple  statements last year, Intel said it was aiming to start shipping Sapphire Rapids in 2021, but the goalposts started to move in recent months, with new CEO Pat Gelsinger saying in March that Intel was aiming for the CPU to enter production “around the end of the year.” In Intel’s Computex 2021 keynote at the beginning of this month, Spelman said Sapphire Rapids was set for a 2022 launch.
 It’s not clear how much of a setback the production delay is, but Intel’s processors using next-generation manufacturing processes like 10 nanometer and 7 nanometer have faced multiple delays over the years, which has given an extra edge to rival AMD and companies developing Arm-based CPUs. That has helped AMD  grow its x86 CPU share in the server market to 8.9 percent. AMD has also quadrupled its share of the top 500 supercomputers in the world in a matter of one year.
 The delays are a major reason why Gelsinger, who became CEO in February, has made execution a  top priority for the company as he works to bring the company back to “unquestioned leadership.”
 “Customers must be able to rely on Intel for their products and their strategies for the future,” he said in a letter to employees in February. “While we must set aggressive targets to regain share and leadership, they must also be achievable and done with the highest quality.”
title: 英特尔延迟蓝宝石急流Xeon CPU生产到Q1 2022
title_en: Intel Delays Sapphire Rapids Xeon CPU Production To Q1 2022

 美国联邦储备董事长Jerome Powell周二发誓，只有对即将到来的通货膨胀的恐惧，才能超越超越利率。在令人援助的投资者神经之后，在上周的令人叹为高的官员认为利率将在2023年，可能比预期的一年来，这项评论被视为抚慰的投资者神经。
 BOFA客户仍然大量投资股票，现金分配远低于11.2％的长期平均值。
 在本周到星期三，投资者将70亿美元的股票融入股票和99亿美元进入债券基金，同时从现金资金中拉535亿美元，使用EPFR数据计算BOFA。 
在股票中，新兴市场资金出现了16亿美元的流出，自2020年9月以来最大。  由于2021年上半年绘图，哈特尼特表示，较高的通货膨胀，开头的中央银行和较弱的增长是在下半场观察的关键主题。
note_en:
LONDON, June 25 (Reuters) - BofA expects U.S. inflation to remain elevated for two to four years, against a rising perception of it being transitory, and said that only a financial market crash would prevent central banks from tightening policy in the next six months.
 It was "fascinating so many deem inflation as transitory when stimulus, economic growth, asset/commodity/housing inflations (are) deemed permanent", the investment bank's top strategist Michael Hartnett said in a note on Friday.
 Hartnett thinks inflation will remain in the 2%-4% range over the next 2-4 years. U.S. inflation has averaged 3% in the past 100 years, 2% in the 2010s, and 1% in 2020, but it has been annualising at 8% so far in 2021, Bofa said in the note.
 Global stocks were holding near record highs hours ahead of the reading of May core personal consumption expenditures index, an inflation gauge tracked closely by the Fed. The gauge is estimated to rise 3.4% year-on-year.
 U.S. Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell vowed on Tuesday not to raise interest rates too quickly based only on the fear of coming inflation. The comments were seen as a move to soothe investor nerves after a hawkish monetary policy meeting last week suggested officials believed interest rates would rise as soon as 2023, perhaps a year earlier than anticipated.
 BofA clients were still heavily invested in equities, with cash allocations well below long-term averages at 11.2%.
 In the week to Wednesday, investors pumped $7 billion into equities and $9.9 billion into bond funds, while pulling $53.5 billion from cash funds, BofA calculated, using EPFR data.
 Within equities, emerging market funds saw outflows of $1.6 billion - the largest since September 2020.
 As the first half of 2021 is drawing to close, Hartnett said higher inflation, hawkish central banks and weaker growth are the key themes to watch out for in the second half.
title: 美国，通胀可能持续高达四年 -  BOFA
title_en: U.S. inflation likely to remain elevated for up to four years – BofA
